text: Aleppo ( ['Ä§alab], , ) is a city in northern Syria. From 2012 to 2016 it was a battlefield in the Syrian civil war. In 2010 it had an official population of 4.6 million. Then, Aleppo was the largest Syrian city. After 2010, however, Aleppo is probably the second-largest city in Syria after the capital Damascus. Aleppo is one of the oldest continuously lived in (lived in all the time) cities in the world. People may have arrived in the 6th millennium BC.Columbia Encyclopedia, 6th edition, 2010. There was a large earthquake near Aleppo in 1138. == References ==
title: Aleppo
